quizz.storybegin: Question one : Find the logs I left on the machine
quizz.question: What is the repository of the files called 'secure****' ?
indice: There is no man tool on this machine but you can run 'man -k find' on you computer
something like that will do the job : find / -name ****
find / -name secure* 2>/dev/null
quizz.answer: The files Secure-*** contains all log about connection attempt
quizz.storyEnd: Have a look to these files whit 'head'

quizz.question: How many sshd log are present in the file?
indice: Look 'grep' command on man
'wc' allow to compte world but could also be used for line
grep *** | wc -l*
quizz.answer: Look's like the machine received a lot of requests

quizz.storybegin: Question three : What about failed and Invalid?
quizz.question: How many ipV4 different failed to connect ?, Pay attention to cast
indice: you have extract ip and then compte them once from Invalid and Failed log
uniq works only if ip are sorted

grep -hPo '\d{1,}\.\d{1,}\.\d{1,}\.\d{1,}' secure-* 
 mandboption -P allow to use python regex rather than grep regex
uniq works only if ip are sorted
grep -E 'Failed|Invalid' sucre-*| grep -ohP **** | sort | uniq | wc -**
quizz.answer: but it's still hard to find my log

quizz.storybegin: Question four : Maybe you could compare with Accepted IP
quizz.question: Give me the ip of the person who have been connect six times?
indice: uniq have a great option to compte occurence
grep Accepted | grep -oPh **** | sort | uniq -c

quizz.storybegin: Question seven : Now you are going to see csv file. There is one heavy city.csv in /home/csv
quizz.question: how many column there is ?
indice: you send teh first line to cut
you can specifie to cut what is the separator and the colum
head -n 1 city.csv| cut -d',' -f**

quizz.question: how many column in city.csv
indice: head -n 1 city.csv | grep -o , | wc -l

quizz.question: give me the list of the city that have 140 birth in NAISSANCES_1990-1999? I expect this format: LE PORT,PEYNIER
indice: join -1 1 -2 1  -t, <( grep ',140.0' birth.csv| sort) <(sort city.csv ) | cut -d',' -f1
cut -d',' -f1-3 city.csv|grep -f code.csv https://shapeshed.com/unix-join/
grep ',140.0' birth.csv | cut -d',' -f1 > code.csv
